repnme.cdata!:
Cote d'Ivoire - Transport Sector
            Adjustment/Investment Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Transport Sector
            Adjustment/Investment Credit Project for Cote d'Ivoire
            were as follows: outcomes were unsatisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was substantial, the Bank performance
            was moderately unsatisfactory, and the Borrower performance
            was also moderately unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: the macroeconomic context and the status of
            public/sectoral finances should be carefully assessed during
            the preparation of transformational projects to ensure
            adequate funding and financial coverage during
            implementation. The preparation and implementation of a
            project should be cognizant of the political economy factors
            affecting it but at the same should primarily focus on the
            objectives, components and activities supported by the
            project. Assurance of continued support to institutional
            reforms in the medium term should be sought in the form of
            adequate personnel and funding and compliance with the legal
            framework. The mentoring and evaluation (M&E) framework
            should be simple, easily implementable without too much
            reliance on project funding, and the Borrower should see a
            clear benefit in implementing it. The government should
            identify and empower a champion to push through sectoral
            reforms through entrenched vested interests. The Bank's
            added value is to facilitate the implementation of
            institutional reform by leveraging its global experience of reforms.
